10 Incredible Stops on a Pacific Coast Highway Road Trip

From Los Angeles to San Francisco

The Pacific Coast Highway (PCH) was first started in the 1930s, and remains one of the most astoundingly scenic roads in the world, spreading over 600 miles (900 kilometers) of California’s beautiful coastlines. This very popular roadtrip roads is a fantastic opportunity to discover California, admiring the magnificiant landscapes, pioneer outposts, surfing villages, while also making stops in major cities. Theoretically, the PCH goes all the way from San Diego to Vancouver, so quite a long way! However, we've created an itinary that goes from Los Angeles to San Francisco, with 10 incredible stops on the way, making it an easier roadtrip if you're flying in and out of California.

Average distance

460 miles

10h00min

Starting point :
— Los Angeles —

There is a lot to see and do in Los Angeles. We recommend that you stop in Marina Del Rey, just a stone throw away from the airport, one of the biggest marina in the world, full of incredible yachts. Then head on towards the quirky Venice, and stroll around the beautiful canals, a hidden gem just a few steps from beach but well worth a detour. Walk along the Hollywood Walk of Fame, drive down Sunset Boulevard and stroll down Rodeo Drive. You could check out the awesome views of the Hollywood sign from Griffith Observatory.

– In total –

0 min
0 mi

– Since the last point –

0 min
0 mi

— Santa Monica —

With its “Baywatch” beaches, white sand and old-fashioned Pier, it is a really nice spot to spend a day. It is quite easy to walk around in Santa Monica, you can also hire a bike, you'll see lots of people strolling by the beach, all the way from Venice beach. The Pier and 3rd Street Promenade are always buzzing with loads of activities and plenty of shops. If you walk further away from the center towards the north, you'll encounter incredible houses.

– In total –

28 min
8.1 mi

– Since the last point –

28 min
8.1 mi

— Malibu —

Malibu has incredible beaches, more natural than the slightly artificial look of the Santa Monica ones. Follow the signs to Point Dume and you’ll find a beautiful sandy beach, headlands, cliffs and rocky coves. Take a walk around Malibu and you’ll find piers and super healthy restaurants. Exit Malibu via the stunning Topanga Canyon – a popular weekend hideaway for Hollywood superstars for years. Stay on Route 27 and you’ll come across offbeat stores, diners and ramshackle saloons along the roadside. Get out at the top for an awesome view over the San Fernando Valley at the top of Topanga Overlook.

– In total –

58 min
26.5 mi

– Since the last point –

30 min
18.4 mi

— Santa Barbara —

Santa Barbara has a really nice vibe, a perfect mix between casual beach, history and city attractions. This is a city filled with adobe homes, Spanish Colonial Revival architecture and mansions, you can learn more about the city’s colonial history at the Old Mission Santa Barbara. Shop and explore the city’s arts district known as the Funk Zone as well as the multiple crafty shops. Animal and flora lovers will enjoy Santa Barbara Zoo, Santa Barbara Botanic Garden and Lotusland. The pier hosts plenty of restaurants with plenty of seafood choice.

– In total –

2h11 min
93.4 mi

– Since the last point –

1h13 min
66.9 mi

— Morro Bay —

Morro Bay is a seaside fishing village with bustling waterfront and gorgeous natural setting. Home to world-famous Morro Rock, this seaside destination serves as the backdrop to an abundance of year-round activities like boating, kayaking, surfing, golfing, hiking and biking. At Morro Bay State Park, you may see any number of wild animals including blue herons, monarch butterflies, hummingbirds and sea otters. The park offers trails, a small museum and picnic benches, making it a perfect road trip stop for when you need to stretch your legs.

– In total –

4h06 min
213.4 mi

– Since the last point –

1h55 min
120 mi

— Cambria and San Simeon —

On the way into Cambria, stop at the Piedras Blancas Friends of the Elephant Seal rookery, where crowds of elephant seals mate and fight (don't get too close, they can be dangerous) Continue to the charming seaside village, home to rocky shorelines, bluffs and tide pools teeming with sea life. When you hit San Simeon, make your way up to Hearst Castle on The Enchanted Hill and you can travel back in time as you make your way through more than 250,000 acres of rooms, suites, cottages, kitchens and grounds.

– In total –

4h32 min
234.1 mi

– Since the last point –

26 min
20.7 mi

— Big Sur —

To get to the Big Sur you’ll travel over the Bixby Bridge – one of the highest bridges of its kind in the world, soars 260 feet above the bottom of a steep canyon carved by Bixby Creek and one of the most photographed bridges on the West Coast. There are many beautiful sights along the Big Sur – Pfeiffer Beach, McWay Falls, Point Sur State Historic Park, Ragged Point – it’ll be hard to get any driving done with all the lookout points. If you have time, take a few days to relax along the route.

– In total –

7h03 min
323.4 mi

– Since the last point –

2h31 min
89.3 mi

— Monterey Bay —

On your way to Monterey, check out the stunning Point Lobos State Natural Reserve and chill at the Old Fisherman’s Wharf. If you have time, stop by Carmel-by-the-Sea a nice seaside village with shops, cafes and restaurants. Monterey is well known for its Aquarium (yes the one in Saving Nemo!) situated in Cannery Row where you can also find shops and restaurants. Constantly surprising with new exhibits and programs, and with a dedication to marine education and conservation, the aquarium is ranked among the top attractions in the world and well worth a visit.

– In total –

8h10 min
351.8 mi

– Since the last point –

1h07 min
28.4 mi

— Santa Cruz —

Santa Cruz is a friendly beach town with gorgeous redwood trees and waves that surfers from all over flock to ride. Founded in 1907, the Santa Cruz Boardwalk has an old-school Americana vibe with its old-fashioned roller coasters and arcade. The Mystery Spot – a collection of strange phenomena from the last 70 years – also makes for an entertaining few hours. The Wharf is a great place to start for restaurants and shops and if you have the time you can go on a whale watching boat or fishing expedition.

– In total –

9h00 min
395.4 mi

– Since the last point –

50 min
43.6 mi

— San Francisco —

Take a drive over the Golden Gate Bridge and you’ll feel like you’ve well and truly arrived in San Francisco. There’s loads to do in San Francisco, but parking can be hard to find, so it's better to get around via the famous San Francisco tram or walk. Spend some time in Fisherman’s Wharf and try some of the seafood. Book a visit to Alcatraz Island by ferry or just relax with a coffee in Union Square but make sure to walk down crazy Lombard Street.

– In total –

10h04 min
456.5 mi

– Since the last point –

1h04 min
61.1 mi

— Los Angeles —

Roughly six miles north of Los Angeles International Airport sits Marina del Rey, a charming coastal community with sailboats, beaches, and bike paths. Head towards Hollywood, on the way you'll go through Beverly Hills, take Rodeo Drive to go down Sunset Boulevard. Stroll down Hollywood Walk of Fame and stop by the TCL Chinese Theatre where you'll find celebrities hands and footprints. From Hollywood, get higher in the hill to access the Griffith Park and Observatory. The Observatory opens a window onto the universe with its planetarium, exhibitions and the opportunity to peer into the Zeist Telescope. You'll also enjoy some amazing views of the city especially at sunset.

– Weather forecast in Los Angeles –

Our secret spot

– The Old LA Zoo –

Tucked inside the expansive Griffith Park property, the Old LA Zoo is essentially exactly what it sounds like: a series of ruins remaining from the former Los Angeles Zoo. The abandoned space is simultaneously eerie and intriguing, and offers a glimpse into the days of LA past with its empty cages and enclosures. Today, the ruins offer unique picnic sites and hiking trails.

Top Choices to

– Eat –

  • Oaks Gourmet
  • Little Fork
  • Life Food Organic
  • Aroma Coffe & Tea
  • Bob's Big Boy
  • Yuca's

– Sleep –

  • Beverly Terrace Hotel

  • Best Western Hollywood Hills
  • Highland Gardens Hotel
  • Magic Castle Hotel
  • Safari Inn

— Santa Monica —

If you start from Venice going up towards Santa Monica you'll get an opportunity to pass Venice Beach and the Boardwalk. Between quirky tourist shops, you'll meet a very ecclectic crowd of artists, new agers, freaks and free spirits : that's the place to be to relive the hippie heyday.
Following the beach towards the North, you'll arrive to Santa Monica and its famous pier. Once the very end of the mythical Route 66, it's the city's most compelling landmark. There you can find a vintage carrousel, a Ferris wheel and a rollercoaster, arcades, restaurants and plenty of tourist stands. The surrounded beach is one of the nicest, with very fine white sand. If you walk towards the center, you'll reach Third Street Promenade, a dynamic high street with plenty of street performers.

– Weather forecast in Santa Monica –

Our secret spot

– Venice Canals –

Even many Angelenos have no idea that just a couple of blocks away from Venice Beach madness sits a surprinsingly quiet and peaceful neighborhood. The Venice Canal Walk threads past a mix of quaint houses and other very modern ones, over bridges surrounded by palm trees and waterways where ducks cohabit with the residents rowboats.

Top Choices to

– Eat –

  • Cafe Crepe
  • Curious palate
  • Rustic Canyon
  • True Food Kitchen
  • Blue Plate Taco
  • Sunny Blue

– Sleep –

  • Sea Blue Hotel
  • Shore Hotel
  • Le Meridien Delfina
  • Hotel Shangri-La
  • Hotel Casa del Mar
  • Palihouse Santa Monica

— Malibu —

While you head towards Malibu, stop at the Getty Villa, this famous museum is a stunning 64-acres showcase for reek, Romand and Etruscan antiquities amassed by J Paul Getty. Malibu is famous for the number of celebrities who resides in the area, and that's no wonder considering the incredible coastal mountains, natural beaches : we recommend Westward Beach, Zuna and El Matador as well as Point Dume.

– Weather forecast in Malibu –

Our secret spot

– Topanga Canyon –

If you can, make a detour up the mountains towards Topana Canyon, a very scenic route. Topanga Canyon State Park has 36 miles of hiking trails, most link with the Santa Monica Mountain's contiuous Backbone Trail, which means you can hike north and south to other park and canyons. You get incredible vista of both the hills and the sea.

Top Choices to

– Eat –

  • Cafe Habana
  • Canyon Bistro
  • Duck Dive
  • Farmshop
  • Fresh
  • Nobu Malibu

– Sleep –

  • Country Inn
  • Beach Inn
  • The Surfrider
  • The M Malibu
  • Broad House
  • Nobu Ryokan

— Santa Barbara —

Santa Barbara County is a very pleasant area to putter around. Spend your morning soaking up rays at East Beach, then walk out onto Stearns Wharf and down by the harbour. Visit downtown's museums, landmarks and shops along State Street. For nice 360degrees views, stop at the county courthouse and climb up its clock tower For a tour of the vineyards, head up to Santa Barbara's Wine County, Foxen Canyon and the Santa Rita Hills are exceptionnally beutiful.

– Weather forecast in Santa Barbara –

Our secret spot

– Santa Barbara Botanic Garden –

Dedicated to California's native flora, this botanic garden host a unique attraction : The Mission Dam. This historic dam and aqueduct system helped supply the Santa Barbara Mission with a reliable source of water. Although no longer a functioning dam, the structure has been preserved and can be viewed from above and below.

Top Choices to

– Eat –

  • Lark
  • Lure Fish House
  • Succulent Cafe
  • Lucky Penny
  • Silverreens
  • Metropulos

– Sleep –

  • Lemon Tree Inn
  • Brisas del Mar
  • Hotel Indigo
  • Hotel Milo
  • Hotel Santa Barbara
  • Canary Hotel

— Morro Bay —

Just off Morro Bay's shore sits a massive, ancient volcanic plug known as Morro Rock rises 576 feet from the ocean, makin it impossible to mistake Morro Bay for any other California seaside town. Fishermen plied their trade in the shadow of Morro Rock for decades; today, the town maintains its sea-faring charm with a full menu of activities added : from ocean-side golf, kayaking, sailing, hiking, fishing, surfing, biking, and bird watching, to kite flying, shopping, dining, wine bars, local craft brews and miles of unspoiled beaches, there is something for all ages to enjoy.

– Weather forecast in Morro Bay –

Our secret spot

– Black Hill Trail –

Of all the Morros in San Luis Obispo County, Black Hill is the easiest to summit. This 661-foot volcanic peak in Morro Bay State Park can be reached by hiking 0.6 miles round trip up a dirt single track with 190 feet of elevation gain and incredible views over the city of Morro Bay. For those looking for more, there are longer hikes to the summit starting farther down Black Hill.

Top Choices to

– Eat –

  • House of Juju
  • Wee Shack
  • Bayside Cafe
  • The Galley
  • Harbor Hut
  • Hungry Fisherman

– Sleep –

  • Estero Inn
  • Anderson Inn
  • Sundown Inn
  • The Landing
  • Masterpiece Hotel
  • Pleasant Inn

— Cambria and San Simeon —

Cambria lies midway between Los Angeles and San Francisco. It's a picturesque village with a vibrant art community, fabulous restaurants and seaside vistas.
Hearst Castle is an extravagent monument that is really worth a visit. On your way there through the winding ranch road, you might see zebras grazing on the Castle's land from Highway 1.
Carrying on along the coast, you'll reach the Elephant Seal Vista Point. The Piedras Blancas Rookery is the only elephant seal rookery in the world that is easily accessible, free, and open to the public every day of the year.
On your way out of San Simeon, stop by Ragged Point for the breathtaking million dollar view atop rocky cliffs, and a secret waterfall.

– Weather forecast in Cambria –

Our secret spot

– Hearst Castle –

Hearst Castle’s history begins in 1865, when George Hearst purchased 40,000 acres of ranchland. William Randolph Hearst inherited thousands of acres around San Simeon and over time kept acquiring more. He conceived a retreat he called La Cuesta Encantada—Spanish for “Enchanted Hill.” The estate comprises 165 rooms and 123 acres of gardens, terraces, pools and walkways.

Top Choices to

– Eat –

  • Robin's
  • Indigo Moon
  • The Sow's Ear
  • Cambria Cafe
  • Sebastian's
  • Linn's Restaurant

– Sleep –

  • Cambria Pines Lodge
  • Fogcatcher Inn
  • Moonstone Landing
  • 9 Iron Inn
  • J. Patrick House
  • Little Sur Inn

— Big Sur —

Raw beauty and an intense maritime energy characterize this land shoehorned between the Santa Lucia Range and the Pacific Ocean, and a first glimpse of the craggy, unspoiled coastline is a special moment. simply, a place you want to be—bluffs, sea, and sky. The classic drive through Big Sur, along twisting Highway 1, offers plenty of pullovers at places like Bixby Bridge. Stop at parks along the coastline and look up to see endangered California condors, North America’s largest birds, or look down to scan the swells for migrating whales or sea otters floating among dense beds of kelp, California’s signature seaweed.

– Weather forecast in Big Sur –

Our secret spot

– McWay Falls –

McWay Falls is a beautiful and remarkable waterfall dropping into an untouched cove on the California coast. In years past, the 80-foot waterfall landed right in the ocean. A 1983 landslide deposited sand at the base of the waterfall and created the sandy cove seen today beside McWay Falls. Now McWay Falls only touches the ocean when high tide waves roll ashore.

Top Choices to

– Eat –

  • Cafe Kevah
  • Coast Gallery & Cafe
  • Sur Restaurant
  • Nepenthe
  • Fernwood Grill
  • The Sur House

– Sleep –

  • Big Sur River Inn
  • Big Sur Lodge
  • Carmel Cottage Inn
  • The Hideaway
  • Highlands Inn
  • Tickle Pink Inn

— Monterey Bay —

Wrapped by the Pacific on three sides, the Monterey Peninsula offers wind-tossed beaches and quiet coves, fine dining and casual eats, early history and postmodern art. World-renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium, is a must-visit, especially for families. Step outside on Cannery Row and you'll find yourself among hotels, shops, and restaurants. For nature lovers, follow the coast south around the peninsula to Pacific Grove, Asilomar State Beach, and the sea-and-spray beauty. On Monterey Peninsula’s south side, it's worth exploring artsy Carmel-by-the-Sea. The Carmel Mission is one of the state’s most beautiful, and shady trails fan out from the site into lush Mission Trail Nature Preserve.

– Weather forecast in Monterey Bay –

Our secret spot

– Point Lobos –

This beautiful coastal state natural reserve feels a million miles away from anything tourist-y. Walk the path to the tip of the park’s limestone point to look down into turquoise-blue water. With binoculars, scan the water for sea otters, harbor seals, and sea lions, and further out to sea, look for whales.

Top Choices to

– Eat –

  • Rosine's Restaurant
  • The Fish Hopper
  • Montrio Bistro
  • Hula's Island Grill
  • Cafe Fina
  • Jacks Monterey

– Sleep –

  • The Monterey Hotel
  • Monterey Tides
  • Hotel Pacific
  • Hotel Abrego
  • Hotel 1110
  • Portola Hotel

— Santa Cruz —

There're two sides to Santa Cruz : the family fun of the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, an esplanade lined with classic coasters, arcade games, corn dogs, and a historic carousel. Then there’s the natural side of it, Santa Cruz is great spot to take a boat tour out from the wharf for excellent whale-watching—grays, blues, or humpbacks, depending on the time of year. Santa Cruz is also the place where surfing was originally introduced in the U.S., and top surfers know that the place to be is Steamer Lane.

– Weather forecast in Santa Cruz –

Our secret spot

– Santa Cruz Wine Country –

If you head inland just a bit, you can see the ancient trees at Big Basin Redwoods State Park, located in the Santa Cruz Mountains. And there’s one other nature-inspired gem tucked in these mountains: a generous selection of wineries (more than 70) most specializing in Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Cabernet Sauvignon.

Top Choices to

– Eat –

  • Lago Di Como
  • Harbor Cafe
  • Riva Fish House
  • Gilda's
  • Johnny's Harborside
  • Laili

– Sleep –

  • Bella Notte
  • PacificBlue Inn
  • Pelican Point Inn
  • Sea & Sand Inn
  • Seaway Inn
  • West Cliff Inn

— San Francisco —

It may measure less than 50 square miles/130 square kilometers, but San Francisco ranks as one of the greatest cities in the world. One of the best way to visit it is by walking as parking is difficult, it'll also give you a chance to really immerse yourself in this city with so many facets. Famous for grand-dame Victorians, classic cable cars, dynamic diversity, a beautiful waterfront, and its red bridge, the “City by the Bay” truly has it all. A nice circuit would be to start at the Walt Disney Museum, carry on towards the Palace of FineArts (or R2D2 building), carry on towards Fisherman’s Wharf to enjoy the many waterfront restaurants before heading inland towards landmarks like Lombard Street or the Coit Tower.

– Weather forecast in San Francisco –

Our secret spot

– The Walt Disney Family Museum –

Although not very well-known, this museum situated by the Golen Gate Bridge is an absolute gem. Through a very well-presented and dynamic exhibition, you get to learn how Walter Disney built his empire from scratch with very little if an absolute passion for entertainment and resiliance.

Top Choices to

– Eat –

  • E'Tutto Qua
  • Scoma's Restaurant
  • Franciscan Crab
  • Hollywood Cafe
  • Perry's on Union
  • Pacific Catch

– Sleep –
